means: 优待亲戚，重用亲戚，裙带关系

sentence.Network_en: Cage changed his name to deflect accusations of nepotism.
sentence.Network_cn: 凯奇改了名字以避免别人指责他搞裙带关系。

sentence.Network_en: He has an incurable and widespread nepotism.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们有不可救药的,到处蔓延的裙带主义.

sentence.Network_en: Many will regard his appointment as the kind of nepotism British banking ought to avoid.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人会把他的任命看作是英国银行业应该避免的一种裙带关系。

RelatedPhrase.word: lashed the president for his nepotism

list.key: lashed the president for his nepotism
list.abs: The congressman lashed the president for his nepotism ., 国会议员抨击总统搞裙带关系.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French népotisme, from Italian nepotismo, from nipote 'nephew' (with reference to privileges bestowed on the ‘nephews’ of popes, who were in many cases their illegitimate sons)

entry.def: Nepotism is the unfair use of power in order to get jobs or other benefits for your family or friends.

example.ex: Many will regard his appointment as the kind of nepotism British banking ought to avoid.
example.tran: 很多人会把他的任命看作是英国银行业应该避免的一种裙带关系。

means.word_mean: 1. favoritism shown to relatives or close friends by those in power (as by giving them jobs)
